message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SD, cs.HC 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with the problem of achieving natural, sustained, coherent and engaging open-domain dialogs. It also addresses several key open-ended problems such as conversational speech recognition, open domain natural language understanding, commonsense reasoning, statistical dialog management, and dialog evaluation, which are all related to the field of natural language processing. 

It is also likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as it deals with the development of conversational AI systems. 

The paper may also belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it discusses the use of statistical and hierarchical dialog managers and model-driven signals from user responses. 

It may also belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.SD (Software Engineering) as it discusses the provision of a suite of tools and models to the competitors including the CoBot (conversational bot) toolkit, topic and dialog act detection models, conversation evaluators, and a sensitive content detection model. 

Finally, it may belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction) as it discusses the goal of achieving engaging conversations with users and improving the user experience.
